Option.Name: right hand only (removes effect if rhand swapped)
left hand only (removes effect if lhand swapped)

iconId.Wiki: ID of icon to use while effect is active

conditionHp.Wiki: Maximum percentage of HP required for effect to activate.\n-1 = no requirement, 40 = less than 40%% HP, 80 = less than 80%% HP

motionInterval.Wiki: Interval (in seconds) for specific effects to be reapplied. 0 = once per frame

maxHpRate.Wiki: Multiplies maximum HP. See bCurrHPIndependeMaxHP to determine how current HP behaves.\n1 = default, .5 = -50%%, 2 = +100%%

physicsAttackRate.Wiki: Multiplies physical damage dealt (post-defense, bypasses attack rating)

magicAttackRate.Wiki: Multiplies magic damage dealt (post-defense, bypasses attack rating)

fireAttackRate.Wiki: Multiplies fire damage dealt (post-defense, bypasses attack rating)

thunderAttackRate.Wiki: Multiplies lightning damage dealt (post-defense, bypasses attack rating)

physicsAttackPower.Wiki: Adds physical damage to attack rating.

magicAttackPower.Wiki: Adds magic damage to attack rating.

fireAttackPower.Wiki: Adds fire damage to attack rating.

thunderAttackPower.Wiki: Adds lightning damage to attack rating.

NoGuardDamageRate.Wiki: Unused. Possibly multiplies damage against non-guarding enemies? (needs testing)

vitalSpotChangeRate.Wiki: Unused. Possibly multiplies damage when hitting a enemy's weak point? (needs testing)

normalSpotChangeRate.Wiki: Unused. Possibly multiplies damage when not hitting an enemy's weak point? (needs testing)

behaviorId.Wiki: ID of BehaviorParam or BehaviorParam_PC to apply to the effect's owner.\nRequires stateInfo to function. stateInfo 142 applies non-player BehaviorParam for attacks only (not bullets).\nstateInfo 171 is used for karmic justice spell but has unknown, possibly hardcoded limitations (needs testing)

changeHpRate.Wiki: Increases/decreases HP by percent of max HP. -100 = heal 100%% HP, 100 = remove 100%% HP

changeHpPoint.Wiki: Flat increase/decrease to HP. -100 = heal 100 damage, 100 = deal 100 damage

magicEffectTimeChange.Wiki: Does nothing. Lingering Dragoncrest Ring uses stateinfo 193 which checks for isExtendSpEffectLife.

insideDurability.Wiki: Flat increase/decrease to durability.\n-100 = restore 100 durability, 100 = consume 100 durability

maxDurability.Wiki: Affects hits required before durability is consumed. 5 = +5 hits before durability consumed, -5 = -5 hits before durability consumed

fallDamageRate.Wiki: Does nothing. Fall control effects use stateInfo 47

animIdOffset.Wiki: Offsets animation IDs. Frequently used to make enemies swap movesets.

haveSoulRate.Wiki: Multiplies the amount of souls granted after death. May only work when added via npcParam? (needs testing)

targetPriority.Wiki: Chance for an enemy to switch aggro targets to/away the effect's owner. Values range from -1 to 1. +1 = 100% chance to target owner instead of current target, -1 = 100% chance to target somebody else instead of current target (effect owner).

sightSearchEnemyCut.Wiki: Reduces distance for enemies to see the effect's owner.\n0 = default, 50 = -50%% sight distance, 100 = -100%% sight distance

hearingSearchEnemyCut.Wiki: Reduces distance for enemies to hear the effect's owner.\n0 = default, 50 = -50%% hearing distance, 100 = -100%% hearing distance

grabityRate.Wiki: Multiplies animation speeds. 1 = default, .5 = -50%% speed, 2 = +100%% speed

soulStealRate.Wiki: Unknown. Internal description says "defense against HP when NPCs are robbed by soul steal".

lifeReductionRate.Wiki: Multiplies the duration of the status effect specified with lifeReductionType.

replaceSpEffectId.Wiki: ID of spEffectParam to add once this effect ends.

cycleOccurrenceSpEffectId.Wiki: ID of spEffectParam to add once every motionInterval

atkOccurrenceSpEffectId.Wiki: ID of spEffectParam to add to victim when the owner hits an enemy.\nRequires stateInfo 152 or 153 (and likely other values used for weapon buffs) to work (VFX present)

guardStaminaCutRate.Wiki: Multiplies shield stability. Requires stateInfo 158 (magic shield) or stateInfo 204 (great magic shield) to work (VFX present). Note that stability values over 100 nullify all stamina damage.

rayCastPassedTime.Wiki: Unknown. Only used for unused "Evil Eye". Internal description says "Gaze passing: activation time (milliseconds)."

changeSuperArmorPoint.Wiki: Flat increase/decrease to poise. Requires stateInfo 155 to work.

bowDistRate.Wiki: Modifies ShotRange (effective distance) for ranged weapons. 0 = default, 50 = +50%%? (values needs testing)

spCategory.Wiki: Determines special effect stacking behavior; how effects will react when another effect in the same category is added.

categoryPriority.Wiki: Used with specific spCategory values to determine stacking behavior. The higher the value, the lower the priority.

saveCategory.Wiki: Used to save effects so that they remain after quitting and loading the game. Only one effect per saveCategory is saved. (needs testing)

heroPointDamage.Wiki: Flat increase/decrease to humanity stat. -1 = add 1 humanity, 1 = remove 1 humanity

bloodDamageRate.Wiki: Possibly affects bleed damage dealt? (needs testing)

spAttribute.Wiki: Special damage type. Changes visual/audio effects on hit and death animations.

stateInfo.Wiki: ID of hardcoded system to use for unique effects. Causes effects itself and is necessary for certain fields to work.\nSee DS1 stateInfo List.\nAlso used for visual effects by referring to the ID of a SpEffectVfxParam to use if useSpEffectEffect is true.

wepParamChange.Wiki: Determines how specific fields, such as damage modifiers, behave with certain attack "categories"

moveType.Wiki: Offsets character movement animations. Possibly refers to MoveParam? (needs testing)

lifeReductionType.Wiki: Determines the type of status effect to modify the duration of using lifeReductionRate.

addBehaviorJudgeId_condition.Wiki: Used to prevent certain attack behaviors from occurring. How values correlate with behaviors is unknown. (needs testing)

addBehaviorJudgeId_add.Wiki: Unknown. Never used. Internal description suggests that this is a constant added to all behavior judge IDs, but tests have been unsuccessful (needs testing).

effectTargetFriend.Wiki: Will affect the effect's owner's allies.

effectTargetEnemy.Wiki: Will affect the effect's owner's enemies.

effectTargetAttacker.Wiki: When effect is added via equipParamWeapon spEffectBehavior field, this field determines if the effect will be applied to attacked enemies instead of the effect owner.\ntrue = affects victim, false = affects owner

dispIconNonactive.Wiki: Unknown. Never used. Internal description says (approximately) "display icon even when effect is waiting to be active."

useSpEffectEffect.Wiki: Determines if visual effects via SpEffectVfxParam should be used. See stateInfo for the ID of SpEffectVfxParam to be used.

bAdjustMagicAblity.Wiki: Determines if certain fields will be modified by a sorcery tool's(?) magic adjustment. (actual conditions need testing)

bAdjustFaithAblity.Wiki: Determines if certain fields will be modified by a miracle tool's(?) magic adjustment. (actual conditions need testing)

magParamChange.Wiki: Determines if certain fields, such as damage multipliers, will also affect sorceries and pyromancies.

miracleParamChange.Wiki: Determines if certain fields, such as damage multipliers, will also affect miracles.

requestSOS.Wiki: Used only by White Sign Soapstone. Probably used for network matchmaking.

requestBlackSOS.Wiki: Used only by Red Sign Soapstone. Probably used for network matchmaking.

requestForceJoinBlackSOS.Wiki: Used only by (Cracked) Red Eye Orb. Probably used for network matchmaking.

requestKickSession.Wiki: Possibly kicks all clients out of your world.

requestLeaveSession.Wiki: Used only by Black Separation Crystal. Probably used to leave network sessions.

requestNpcInveda.Wiki: Used only by Black Eye Orb (Lautrec quest and cut Shiva quest)

noDead.Wiki: If true, character cannot die (may be DSR or debug build only? needs testing!)

bCurrHPIndependeMaxHP.Wiki: Determines how current HP behaves when maximum HP is modified. true = current HP will not change, false = current HP will change with max HP

corrosionIgnore.Wiki: Possibly makes owner immune to durability damaging effects? (needs testing)

sightSearchCutIgnore.Wiki: Possibly makes owner ignore sightSearchEnemyCut? (needs testing)

hearingSearchCutIgnore.Wiki: Possibly makes owner ignore hearingSearchEnemyCut? (needs testing)

antiMagicIgnore.Wiki: Possibly makes owner ignore Vow of Silence? (needs testing)

fakeTargetIgnore.Wiki: Possibly makes owner ignore Aural Decoy? (needs testing)

fakeTargetIgnoreUndead.Wiki: Possibly makes owner ignore Alluring Skull? (needs testing)

enableCharm.Wiki: Possibly makes owner vulnerable to Undead Rapport? (needs testing)

enableLifeTime.Wiki: Possibly makes effect end when owner dies? (may require stateInfo, needs testing)

hasTarget.Wiki: Unknown. Only used for unused "Evil Eye".

isFireDamageCancel.Wiki: Unknown. Never used. Does not grant immunity to fire damage.

isExtendSpEffectLife.Wiki: Determines if effectEndurance will be affected by stateInfo 193 which is used by the Lingering Dragoncrest Ring.

requestLeaveColiseumSession.Wiki: Used only by Purple Coward's Crystal.

vowType0.Wiki: Effect usable while in no covenant.

vowType1.Wiki: Effect usable while in Way of White covenant.

vowType2.Wiki: Effect usable while in Princess Guard covenant.

vowType3.Wiki: Effect usable while in Warrior of Sunlight covenant.

vowType4.Wiki: Effect usable while in Darkwraith covenant.

vowType5.Wiki: Effect usable while in Path of the Dragon covenant.

vowType6.Wiki: Effect usable while in Gravelord Servant covenant.

vowType7.Wiki: Effect usable while in Forest Hunter covenant.

vowType8.Wiki: Effect usable while in Blade of the Dark Moon covenant.

vowType9.Wiki: Effect usable while in Chaos Servant covenant.
